::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module1_mcq_q98')" data-correct-answer="B"> 
  <strong style="display: block;">Aurora Technologies raised capital in two rounds (values in millions USD): Series A: Pre-money = 12, Post-money = 20, Series B: Pre-money = 50, Post-money = 80.   What percentage of the company do the Series B investors own after their investment?</strong> 
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_mcq_q98" value="A"> A. 25%</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_mcq_q98" value="B"> B. 37.5%</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_mcq_q98" value="C"> C. 40%</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_mcq_q98" value="D"> D. 50%</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_mcq_q98" value="E"> E. 62.5%</label><br>
</form> 

<div id="feedback-module1_mcq_q98" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;"> 
✅ Correct: B. The Series B investors contributed (80 − 50) = 30 million. Since Post-money = 80, they hold 30 ÷ 80 = 37.5% of the company. 
</div>
